intro: Gymnanthes klotzschiana, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a tropical shrub native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking, purple-red berries that appear in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Its berries are edible when ripe but can be toxic if consumed in large quantities. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant fruit and attractive foliage.
